xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas
Class SortMergeEquiJoinSA<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.AbstractSweepArea<E>
      xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
          xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.SortMergeEquiJoinSA<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SweepArea<E>, MemoryMonitorable, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class SortMergeEquiJoinSA<E>
extends ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>

A SweepArea for sort-based equijoins. In this special case of a join, the retrieval as well as the reorganization and expiration, respectively, can be improved with regard to efficiency. Querying a SortMergeEquiJoinSA simply returns an iterator over the complete SweepArea, whereas expiration and reorganization benefits from the fact that all elements not equal to the passed argument currentStatus can be removed from the SortMergeEquiJoinSA instantaneously.

See Also:
SortMergeEquivalenceJoin, Predicate, Equal

Constructor Detail

SortMergeEquiJoinSA

public SortMergeEquiJoinSA(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                           int ID,
                           int dim,
                           Predicate<? super E> equals)
Constructs a new SortMergeEquiJoinSA with the specified query-predicate equals. SortMergeEquiJoinSAs permit self-reorganization.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this SortMergeEquiJoinSA.
dim - The dimensionality of this SweepArea, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this SortMergeEquiJoinSA.
equals - Binary predicate that decides if its two arguments are equal.

                         int[] IDs,
                         int valid)

Returns an iterator over the complete SortMergeEquiJoinSA by calling the method ImplementorBasedSweepArea.iterator(). This version of query additionally allows to use partially filled arrays and specifies how many entries of such a partially filled array are valid.

expire

public Iterator<E> expire(E currentStatus,
                          int ID)
                   throws IllegalStateException
In an SortMergeEquiJoin all elements that are not equal to currentStatus can be removed from this SortMergeEquiJoinSA. Therefore, this method checks if this SortMergeEquiJoinSA contains any element or the first element is equal to currentStatus. In both cases, an empty cursor is returned. Otherwise, all elements of this SortMergeEquiJoinSA are returned as a cursor and removed during traversal.

Specified by:
expire in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
expire in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to detect expired elements.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
Returns:
an iteration over the elements which expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

reorganize

public void reorganize(E currentStatus,
                       int ID)
                throws IllegalStateException
In contrast to the method expire(Object, int), this method directly removes all expired elements from a SweepArea without returning them. Consequently, this SortMergeEquiJoinSA is cleared whenever currentStatus is not equal to the first element of this SortMergeEquiJoinSA.

Specified by:
reorganize in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
reorganize in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to perform the reorganization step.
ID - An ID determining from which input this reorganization step is triggered.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.
